summary: The Presidential and First Spouse Coin Act of 2025 mandates the U.S. Mint to issue $1 coins honoring deceased U.S. Presidents not yet featured. It also requires the issuance of bullion coins and bronze medals honoring the spouses of those presidents. The Secretary of the Treasury is given discretion over coin quantities and qualities, with the coins being legal tender and treated as numismatic items. The act outlines design requirements and specifies the timing of issuance.
